00001 //===========================================================================
00051 //===========================================================================
00052 
00053 #include "Array/ArrayIo.h"
00054 #include "LinAlg/fft.h"
00055 
00056 using namespace std;
00057 
00058 
00059 // Simple test function which is sampled:
00060 double func(double t)
00061 {
00062     return t * t;
00063 }
00064 
00065  
00066 int main()
00067 {
00068     double                          t;     // Time.
00069     complex< double >               ft;    // Function value f( t ).
00070     Array< std::complex< double > > data;  // f( t ) for all sample points t.
00071 
00072 
00073     // Create and save sample data (as real value < ft, 0 >):
00074     for ( t = -8.; t < 8.; t += 1. )
00075     {
00076         ft = func( t ); 
00077         data.append_elem( ft );
00078     }
00079 
00080     // Output of original data (in time domain):
00081     cout << "Original data (in time domain):" << endl;
00082     writeArray( data, cout );
00083     cout << endl;
00084 
00085     // Map function from time domain to frequency domain:
00086     fft( data );
00087     cout << "Data in frequency domain:" << endl;
00088     writeArray( data, cout );
00089     cout << endl;
00090 
00091     // Map function from frequency domain to time domain
00092     // (inverse fourier transformation):
00093     ifft( data );
00094     cout << "Data in time domain (after inverse fourier transformation):" 
00095          << endl;
00096     writeArray( data, cout );
00097 
00098     return 0;
00099 }
00100

00102 
00103
